item.title:
RT by @gakonst: Reth v1.2 brought huge performance gains and cleaned several public types and APIs, especially requiring fewer type conversions with revm.
It wasn't perfect, as a breaking API made our custom payload service uglier, so we opened a GitHub issue. It was addressed in 2 weeks and we happily pinned the new commit downstream.
Addressing a low-priority quality-of-life issue in 2 weeks and before a new release is certainly bullish. Reth does care about our DX. Let's "complain" more!

EL clients had an issue where they forgot to add the correct Deposit contract address, which matters for Pectra Requests Hash calculation: - https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/8346 - https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/pull/8265 - https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/31247
Reth and Erigon were ok.

item.title:
Holesky and other testnets exist to find issues.
Excited that Reth & Erigon worked well, and IMO NBD for other teams. Shit happens. We fix and keep shipping as one team. Highly recommend Reth in prod.
Would it have been better had no client had a bug? Sure.
Was the bug easy to find? Yes.
Does it mean we should go slower? No.
